intro: Jaubertia calycoptera, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 meter, featuring dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces striking, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale pink, appearing in clusters during the winter months. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, providing a textured contrast to the delicate blooms. Jaubertia calycoptera is well-suited for coastal gardens due to its tolerance of salt spray and well-drained soils.
